s.text: GS tried to reveal the essence of communication by stringing together heavy words without the punctuation, connectives, adjectives, adverbs, and allusions we are accustomed to.
According to GS, the unemployed do not want to work, and if there were fewer rich people, there would be more poor people.
Living in France in the summer of 1939, she rejected the opinion of well-informed people that war was imminent.
Everybody who earns it and spends it every day in order to live knows that money is money, everybody who votes it to be gathered in as taxes knows money is not money.
The Louis XV story reminds me of one of Ronald Reagan's favorites--about the Muslim philosopher who said that the king came to the throne with high taxes and departed with low revenue.
She was not a woman of great foresight about public events.
But one lesson of this essay is that the Stein family, like every other family, contains some surprises.
But one lesson of this essay is that the Stein family, like every other family, contains some surprises.
As GS might ask, what is the question to which this essay is the answer?
As GS might ask, what is the question to which this essay is the answer?
